intro: Ptilostemon chamaepeuce var. cyprius, commonly known as the Cyprus sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a low-growing herb with narrow, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers that bloom in shades of white and purple. The plant thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rocky or sandy habitats. It is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to withstand drought and salt spray. Its botanical features make it an important component of local flora and a subject of ecological study.
